channel.title: Software Craftsmanship on Incubyte Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Software Craftsmanship on Incubyte Blog

item.title: Incubyte TDD Assessment
item.description: Hello there and welcome to the Incubyte TDD Kata! This assessment is the first step in our recruiting process and will be followed by two pair programming/discussion sessions.

item.title: Ideas for Successful Agile Teams
item.description: Agile is the most discussed software development methodology, and probably most widely accepted as the way forward for modern software development teams.

item.title: 12 Books Developers Must Read
item.description: Books are a massive source of knowledge. Before we list all the books here, we want to discuss why we think it’s essential for programmers to read them.

item.title: Clean Agile with Uncle Bob: A Summary
item.description: An overview: I recently attended an online session on Clean Agile, organized by O’Reilly publication.And guess who was the speaker?

item.title: Do not assume that technical debt is a problem with your code
item.description: Ever saw SonarQube laden with thousands of maintainability and security issues? Looking at those dashboards, we often believe we’re looking at the code’s state, but there is more to it.

item.title: Not All Tests are the Same
item.description: On multiple occasions, I have worked on projects where I learned how critical testing is and that not all tests are the same.

item.title: The Battle of Source Control
item.description: git pull origin develop git checkout -b feature/shiny-new-branch It’s the start of a sprint, and you have picked up a new User Story.

item.title: Why Incubyte?
item.description: Quality is usually an implicit requirement when it comes to developing software. Users ask for a beautiful UI, outstanding performance, and the functionality they need, but quality is never on the list - it is just expected!
